title: Calories in 1 Stick of Butter
meta_description: Learn calories in 1 stick of butter, including full nutrition facts like fat content, cholesterol, sodium, and easy tweaks for lighter options.
assumptions: Standard US stick (1/2 cup, 113 g), unsalted, regular full-fat butter at room temperature.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, fat content, salted/unsalted, and storage; check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: One stick of butter provides about 810 kcal, almost entirely from fat.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Switch to light butter (50% less fat)

faqs.q: How many calories in 1 stick of butter?
faqs.a: Approximately 810 kcal for a standard 113 g stick.

faqs.q: Is a stick of butter mostly fat?
faqs.a: Yes, about 91.5 g total fat, including 57.6 g saturated fat.

faqs.q: How much cholesterol in 1 stick of butter?
faqs.a: Around 243 mg, mostly from animal fat.

faqs.q: Does unsalted vs salted butter affect calories?
faqs.a: No, calories remain the same; salted adds ~643 mg sodium per stick.

faqs.q: What are calories per tablespoon of butter?
faqs.a: About 102 kcal per tablespoon (1/8 stick), scaling from the 100 g basis.
